page.title: 20WEST HULL COMMUNITY CENTRES
page.content: THERE ARE FOUR COMMUNITY CENTRES IN W. HULL; THEY FIRST APPEARED IN THE LATE SEVENTIES, WHEN LOCAL PEOPLE STARTED TO ORGANISE THEIR OWN LEISURE ACTIVITIES, AND BRING PRESSURE ON THE AUTHORITIES TO PROTECT THEIR HOUSING AND OPEN LAND. THE ASSOCIATION LOOKS FOR AN OLD SITE PAYS A CHEAP RENT; AND WITH THE HELP OF LOCAL SCHOOLS, UNEMPLOYED, AND RETIRED PEOPLE, SETS ABOUT ITS RENOVATION. THE PROJECTS ARE FUNDED BY AN INNER CITY GRANT, AND JUMBLE SALES. THE CENTRES ARE STAFFED BY VOLUNTEERS WHO RUN PLAY GROUPS, BINGO FOR THE ELDERLY, YOUTH CLUBS, KEEP FIT GROUPS HOBBIES ROOMS, AND PROVIDE A CENTRE WHERE ANY LOCAL PEOPLE CAN GO FOR A CHAT OR TO HOLD MEETINGS. ONE CENTRE PUT PRESSURE ON THE AUTHORITY TO IMPROVE AND MODERNISE A WHOLE STREET INSTEAD OF ITS PLANNED DEMOLITION.
